title.value: Can Language Models Serve as Creativity Support Tools for Comedy?
title.justification: The title succinctly captures the paper's investigation into the potential of language models as creativity tools for comedy.
title.quote: A Robot Walks into a Bar: Can Language Models Serve as Creativity Support Tools for Comedy? An Evaluation of LLMs’ Humour Alignment with Comedians

extractions.description: This paper evaluates the potential of large language models (LLMs) as creativity support tools for comedy, exploring their alignment with professional comedians' humor. Through workshops and focus groups, the study investigates limitations and ethical implications of using AI in comedy writing.

type.justification: The paper is based on workshops and interviews with professional comedians, assessing the practical use of LLMs in comedy writing.
type.quote: We conducted an empirical study to better understand the current state of LLMs as comedy-writing support tools.

name.justification: The paper involves evaluating AI tools in the context of creative human-computer interactions.
name.quote: We conducted an empirical study to better understand the current state of LLMs as comedy-writing support tools, their use-cases and limitations, and artists’ opinions on ethical questions regarding their use in a comedy-writing context.

name.justification: The paper focuses on evaluating AI as tools for enhancing creativity, especially in the field of comedy.
name.quote: The utility of instruction-tuned LLMs as Creativity Support Tools.

name.justification: The study is centered around language models and their application in generating comedic content.
name.quote: Recent work on the intersection of AI and comedy has demonstrated an appetite for comedians to (try to) write humorous material using AI tools like Large Language Models (LLMs).

name.justification: The study participants used ChatGPT-3.5 for generating comedic content during the workshops.
name.quote: Participants used ChatGPT-3.5, ChatGPT-4 and Google Bard powered by Gemini Pro.

is_contributed.justification: ChatGPT-3.5 is a well-known model used for the study rather than being a new contribution by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: The choice of such instruction-tuned models was motivated by their popularity and ease of access by comedians.

is_executed.justification: Participants interacted with ChatGPT-3.5 to generate content, indicating its execution as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: Participants spent around 45 minutes on their own, using an LLM.

is_compared.justification: The study doesn't focus on comparing ChatGPT-3.5 with other models but rather explores its utility in comedy writing.
is_compared.quote: We encouraged participants to try to use the LLM in a way that would generate useful material.

referenced_paper_title.value: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper discusses the methodology behind the instruction-following capabilities of the ChatGPT models.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Training language models to follow instructions with human feedback.

name.justification: Participants also used ChatGPT-4 during the workshops to assess its potential for comedy writing.
name.quote: Participants used ChatGPT-3.5, ChatGPT-4 and Google Bard powered by Gemini Pro.

is_contributed.justification: ChatGPT-4 is an existing model used in the study but not contributed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: The choice of such instruction-tuned models was motivated by their popularity and ease of access by comedians.

is_executed.justification: Participants interacted with ChatGPT-4 during the workshops, which implies its execution.
is_executed.quote: Participants spent around 45 minutes on their own, using an LLM.

is_compared.justification: The study explores ChatGPT-4's utility without direct numerical comparisons to other models.
is_compared.quote: We encouraged participants to try to use the LLM in a way that would generate useful material.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper likely details the capabilities and technical specifications of ChatGPT-4.

name.justification: Google Bard was one of the models used by participants to explore comedy writing.
name.quote: Participants used ChatGPT-3.5, ChatGPT-4 and Google Bard powered by Gemini Pro.

is_contributed.justification: Google Bard is an existing model utilized in the study, not developed by the authors.
is_contributed.quote: The choice of such instruction-tuned models was motivated by their popularity and ease of access by comedians.

is_executed.justification: Google Bard was actively used in workshops suggesting its execution as part of the study.
is_executed.quote: Participants spent around 45 minutes on their own, using an LLM.

is_compared.justification: There aren't explicit numerical comparisons made between Google Bard and other models in this study.
is_compared.quote: We encouraged participants to try to use the LLM in a way that would generate useful material.

referenced_paper_title.value: Gemini: A Family of Highly Capable Multimodal Models
referenced_paper_title.justification: This reference likely discusses the underlying architecture and capabilities of Google Bard.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Gemini: A Family of Highly Capable Multimodal Models.
